images.alt_text: Black and white photograph of archaeologist Brian Hope-Taylor examining a human skull during the 1948 Farthing Down excavations
images.caption: Brian Hope-Taylor examining skeletal remains at Farthing Down, 1948

images.alt_text: Painting of a wooden Anglo-Saxon drinking vessel with yellow metal bands and Celtic knotwork decoration at the top
images.caption: Painting of a wooden drinking vessel discovered by Wickham Flower (courtesy of Surrey Archaeological Society)

images.alt_text: Historical document titled 'The Farthing Down Excavations' describing the Saxon cemetery discoveries and burial details
images.caption: Document describing the Farthing Down excavations and Saxon cemetery findings

images.alt_text: Information panel about Farthing Down archaeological research project showing excavation photos and text describing the Saxon cemetery site
images.caption: Farthing Down archaeological research project information panel with excavation photographs

images.alt_text: Archaeological site plan showing the layout of the Saxon cemetery at Farthing Downs with burial locations marked as symbols along a linear pattern
images.caption: Saxon Cemetery Farthing Downs - site plan showing burial locations with 100m scale

images.alt_text: Painting of a weathered Anglo-Saxon shield boss artifact showing metal construction with decorative ridges and central spike
images.caption: Painting of a shield boss discovered on Farthing Down by Wickham Flower (courtesy of Surrey Archaeological Society)

images.alt_text: Black and white photograph showing multiple human skulls and skeletal remains arranged on display with boxes
images.caption: Display of human skulls and skeletal remains from Farthing Down excavations

images.alt_text: Black and white photograph showing multiple human skeletons in situ during archaeological excavation, lying in burial positions
images.caption: Multiple burials uncovered during Farthing Down excavations showing skeletons in their original positions
